actor_awards.notes: Francis won a Golden Globe for Best Actress in a Television Series for 'Honey West' (1966), making her the first actress to star in a TV series named after her female detective character. She also received an Emmy nomination for the same role.

filmography.title: Forbidden Planet
filmography.role_description: The innocent, mini-skirted daughter of Dr. Morbius who has never seen a man other than her father until the starship crew arrives, sparking a rivalry for her affection.
filmography.plot: A starship crew goes to investigate the silence of a planet's colony only to find two survivors and a deadly secret that one of them has unleashed.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Special Effects; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Thrills (#97, Nominated), Top 10 Sci-Fi (#1)

filmography.title: Bad Day at Black Rock
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic local woman who runs the garage rental desk and is one of the few townspeople willing to help the stranger, Macreedy.
filmography.plot: A one-armed stranger comes to a tiny town possessing a terrible past they want to keep secret, triggering a violent confrontation.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Director, Best Actor, Best Screenplay; Cannes: Best Actor (Spencer Tracy)

filmography.title: Blackboard Jungle
filmography.role_description: The pregnant, worried wife of teacher Richard Dadier, who becomes a target of harassment by her husband's delinquent students.
filmography.plot: A new English teacher at a violent, unruly inner-city school is determined to do his job, despite resistance from both students and faculty.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Screenplay, Best Cinematography, Best Art Direction, Best Editing

filmography.title: Funny Girl
filmography.role_description: A Ziegfeld Follies showgirl and friend to Fanny Brice who adds glamour and a touch of cynicism to the backstage world.
filmography.plot: The life of comedienne Fanny Brice, from her early days in the Jewish slums of the Lower East Side to the height of her career with the Ziegfeld Follies.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Picture; AFI: Greatest Movie Musicals (#16)

filmography.title: Susan Slept Here
filmography.role_description: The sophisticated, somewhat jealous fiancée of the screenwriter protagonist, who is less than thrilled about him housing a juvenile delinquent for the holidays.
filmography.plot: A screenwriter suffering from writer's block takes in a 17-year-old delinquent girl for the holidays to research a script, leading to romantic complications.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Original Song, Best Sound

filmography.title: The Satan Bug
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a general and former flame of the protagonist, who assists in the desperate search for stolen bioweapons.
filmography.plot: A former intelligence agent is brought back to investigate the theft of a lethal virus from a top-secret government lab that could wipe out life on Earth.

filmography.title: Don't Go Near the Water
filmography.role_description: A Navy nurse and officer who becomes the romantic interest of a fast-talking sailor in this WWII service comedy.
filmography.plot: A Navy public relations unit stationed on a Pacific island during WWII tries to build a clubhouse and stay out of the war, finding romance along the way.

filmography.title: The Rack
filmography.role_description: The supportive sister-in-law of a Korean War veteran facing a court-martial for collaboration with the enemy.
filmography.plot: An American officer returns home after two years in a Korean POW camp, only to face a court-martial for collaborating with his captors.

filmography.title: Brainstorm
filmography.role_description: A manipulative, unhappily married woman who engages in an affair with a scientist and conspires to murder her wealthy husband.
filmography.plot: A scientist saves a woman from suicide and falls for her, leading to a plot to kill her husband and fake insanity to escape punishment.

filmography.title: A Lion Is in the Streets
filmography.role_description: A bayou beauty who becomes the mistress of a charismatic but corrupt politician loosely based on Huey Long.
filmography.plot: A peddler rises to political power in the South by exploiting the poor and making corrupt deals, ultimately betraying those who supported him.

filmography.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
filmography.role_description: The wife of Jerry Lewis's character, who encourages him to live his final days to the fullest, though she may have ulterior motives.
filmography.plot: A man is told by his doctor that he has a terminal illness, so he goes on a lavish spending spree, only to find out the diagnosis was a mistake.

filmography.title: The Crowded Sky
filmography.role_description: A flight attendant on a doomed airliner who deals with her own romantic entanglements amidst a mid-air crisis.
filmography.plot: A Navy jet with a defective radio system and a passenger plane carrying a full load head toward a mid-air collision.

filmography.title: So Young, So Bad
filmography.role_description: A tough, rebellious inmate at a corrective school for girls who becomes a key figure in exposing the abusive conditions.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist at a girls' reform school tries to implement humane treatment but faces opposition from the sadistic head matron.

filmography.title: Battle Cry
filmography.role_description: A 'party girl' who becomes romantically involved with one of the Marines before he ships out to war.
filmography.plot: A group of young men from different backgrounds join the Marines during WWII, facing the hardships of boot camp, romance, and war in the Pacific.

filmography.title: Rogue Cop
filmography.role_description: The moll of a mobster who witnesses a murder and becomes a crucial pawn in a corrupt cop's attempt to play both sides.
filmography.plot: A police detective on the take is forced to hunt down his own brother's killer after the mob double-crosses him.

filmography.title: The Scarlet Coat
filmography.role_description: A woman caught in a romantic triangle between an American spy and a British officer during the Revolutionary War.
filmography.plot: An American officer goes undercover to expose Benedict Arnold's treason and prevent the surrender of West Point to the British.

filmography.title: Dreamboat
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a respectable professor who is shocked to discover her father was once a silent film matinee idol.
filmography.plot: A college professor's past as a silent movie star is revealed when his old films are shown on television, causing chaos in his academic life.

filmography.title: The Rocket Man
filmography.role_description: A young woman who becomes involved in the chaos when a mysterious space gun forces people to tell the truth.
filmography.plot: A little boy finds a ray gun left by a mysterious spaceman that forces anyone caught in its beam to tell the absolute truth.

filmography.title: The Love God?
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated woman involved in the transformation of a meek birdwatcher into a national sex symbol.
filmography.plot: A meek birdwatcher unwittingly becomes the face of a racy men's magazine and a symbol of the sexual revolution.

filmography.title: Girl of the Night
filmography.role_description: A high-priced call girl who seeks psychiatric help to escape her profession and deal with her traumatic past.
filmography.plot: A call girl undergoes psychoanalysis to understand the emotional scars that led her to prostitution and to find a way out.

filmography.title: Elopement
filmography.role_description: A brilliant industrial design student who impulsively elopes with her professor, sparking a cross-country chase by their parents.
filmography.plot: A young couple elopes, pursued by their irate parents who are determined to stop the marriage before it happens.

filmography.title: Lydia Bailey
filmography.role_description: An aristocratic American woman living in Haiti who becomes entangled in the Haitian Revolution against the French.
filmography.plot: An American lawyer travels to Haiti to find a wealthy heiress and sign legal papers, but they are swept up in the native uprising against Napoleon's troops.

filmography.title: The Hired Gun
filmography.role_description: A woman sentenced to hang for murder who is broken out of jail and pursued by a professional gunman hired to bring her back.
filmography.plot: A gunman is hired to track down and return an escaped female convict, but he begins to believe she may be innocent.

filmography.title: Impasse
filmography.role_description: A tennis pro and the daughter of a veteran who joins a group of adventurers searching for gold in the Philippines.
filmography.plot: A group of adventurers searches for a cache of gold bullion hidden in the Philippines during World War II.

filmography.title: Pancho Villa
filmography.role_description: The wife of an arms dealer who gets caught up in the Mexican Revolution alongside Pancho Villa.
filmography.plot: Mexican revolutionary Pancho Villa raids a U.S. Army base to steal weapons after being double-crossed in an arms deal.
